newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares slip at start, seen hitting new peak.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares slip at start, seen hitting new peak.

text.p: Danish share prices dipped in early trade on Tuesday but dealers saw the market recovering to hit new record highs for the eleventh consecutive trading day.

"The index reached a new all-time closing record on Monday yet again due to the strong dollar and sterling. Dollar-sensitive paper like Novo Nordisk and Tele Danmark, which both rose on New York last night, should help push the index ahead today," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index had lost 1.38 point to 184.72 at 0730 GMT, havong closed 0.76 point higher on Monday.
